column5:
The Bakken Museum was founded in 1975 by Earl E. Bakken, inventor of the first transistorized cardiac pacemaker, and includes a great variety of innovations.
Inside the museum you can find Wimshurst Machines, pacemaker collections, and Ben Franklinâ€™s Electricity Party Room all in the setting of a classic 1930s Tudor Mansion.
column6: A museum dedicated to the exploring past, present, and future innovations.
column8: 3537 Zenith Ave. South; Minneapolis, Minnesota, 55416; United States
